info.title: Commerce API
info.summary: Codat's standardized API for accessing commerce data
info.description:
Codat's Commerce API allows you to access standardised data from over 11 commerce and POS systems.

Standardize how you connect to your customersâ€™ payment, PoS, and eCommerce systems. Retrieve orders, payouts, payments, and product data in the same way for all the leading commerce platforms.

[Read more...](https://docs.codat.io/commerce-api/overview)

[See our OpenAPI spec](https://github.com/codatio/oas)

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Customer
items.description:
When a customer places an order with the connected commerce store their details are added to the Customers dataset. You can use the data from the Customers endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as customer churn.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-customers) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

allOf.description:
Default currency of any transactional data for the customer, 
for example, orders or payments

allOf.title: Currency
allOf.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

city.description: The third line of the address, or city

region.description: The fourth line of the address, or region

postalCode.description: The postal (or zip) code for the address

note.description: Any additional information about the customer

createdDate.description: The date the entity was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

disputedTransactions.description: Link to the source event which triggered this transaction.

dueDate.description: Date when the next action in the dispute resolution is due

items.description:
A customer may file a payment dispute with their bank or other card issuer when they're unsatisfied with their purchase or believe they have been charged incorrectly. For example:  
- They didn't receive an order.  
- The product they received was different to the commerce store's description.  
- They've been the victim of online fraud.  

You can use data from the Disputes endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as the number of chargebacks.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-disputes) for this data type.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

schema.title: Company Info
schema.description:
In the Codat system, company information includes standard commercial details about 
a linked company, such as their address, phone number, and company registration.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=companyInfo) for this data type.

commercePlatformRef.description: Identifier or reference for the company in the commerce platform

companyLegalName.description: The full legal name of the company

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

city.description: The third line of the address, or city

region.description: The fourth line of the address, or region

postalCode.description: The postal (or zip) code for the address

phoneNumbers.description: Phone numbers associated with the company

webLinks.description: Web links associated with the company

url.description: The full URL for the weblink

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the company

baseCurrency.title: Currency
baseCurrency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

accountBalances.description: The available and current cash balances for the company's accounts

pending.description: Funds that are not yet available in the balance

get.description:
Retrieve information about the company, as seen in the commerce platform.

This may include information like addresses, tax registration details and social media or website information.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Locations
items.description:
The Locations datatype holds information on geographic locations at which stocks of products may be held, as referenced in the Products data type.

Locations also holds information on geographic locations where orders were placed, as referenced in the Orders data type.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-locations) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of this location

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

city.description: The third line of the address, or city

region.description: The fourth line of the address, or region

postalCode.description: The postal (or zip) code for the address

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

get.description:
Retrieve a list of locations as seen in the commerce platform.

A `location` is a geographic place at which stocks of products may be held, or from where orders were placed.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Orders
items.description:
Orders contain the transaction details for all products sold by the company, and include details of any payments, service charges, or refunds related to each order. You can use data from the Orders endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as gross sales values and monthly recurring revenue (MRR).

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-orders) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

orderNumber.description: Friendly reference for the order in the commerce or point of sale platform.

country.description: The Codat country property is returned as it was provided in the underlying platform by the company without any formatting on our part. Depending on the platform the value of this property will either be an ISO 3166 code (2-alpha or 3-alpha) or free-form text returned as a string name in our model. For POST operations against platforms that demand a specific format for the country code, we have documented accepted values in the [options](https://docs.codat.io/codat-api#/operations/get-companies-companyId-connections-connectionId-push) endpoint.

allOf.title: Currency
allOf.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.
Currency in which the order was placed.

totalAmount.description: Total amount of the order, including tax, net of any discounts and refunds.

totalTaxAmount.description: Total amount of tax applied to the order.

totalDiscount.description: Total amount of discount applied to the order.

totalGratuity.description: Extra amount added to a bill.

quantity.description:
Number of units of the product sold.
For refunds, quantity is a negative value.

taxPercentage.description: Percentage rate (from 0 to 100) of any sale tax applied to the unit amount.

unitPrice.description: Price per unit of goods or service.

taxes.description: Taxes breakdown as applied to order lines.

taxComponentRef.description: Taxes rates reference object depending on the rates being available on source commerce package.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Payment
items.description:
Payments contain details of all payments made by customers to a company, including: amounts, currency used, payment method, payment provider, and payment status.

Refunds are recorded as separate, negative payments. Note that a refund can only occur in relation to a payment that has been completed (i.e. has a status of `Paid`). When a customer cancels an order _before_ a payment has been completed, the payment shows as `Cancelled`.

You can use data from the Payments endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as gross sales and monthly recurring revenue (MRR).

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-payments) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

currency.description: Currency in which the payment was made
currency.title: Currency

paymentMethodRef.description: The payment method the payment is linked to in the commerce platform.
paymentMethodRef.title: nameRef

id.description: The unique identitifer of the record being referenced

name.description: Name of the record being referenced.

paymentProvider.description: Service provider of the payment, if applicable.

dueDate.description: Date by which payment must be made
dueDate.title: Date Time

createdDate.description: The date the entity was created.
createdDate.title: Date Time

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-paymentMethods) for this data type.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Product
items.description:
A Product is an item in the company's inventory, and includes information about the price and quantity of all products, and variants thereof, available for sale.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-products) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the product in the commerce or POS system

description.description: Description of the product recorded in the commerce or point of sale platform.
examples: 1 hour of support from an agent (phone or remote)

categorization.description: Retail category that the product is assigned to

isGiftCard.description:
Whether the product represents a gift card or voucher that
can be redeemed in the commerce or POS platform

items.title: Product Variant
items.description: Represents a variation of a product available for sale, for example an item of clothing that may be available for sale in multiple sizes and colors.

allOf.description: Identifier of the product variant, unique to the company.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the product recorded in the commerce or point of sale platform.

isTaxEnabled.description: Whether sales taxes are enabled for this product variant.

sku.description: SKU (stock keeping unit) of the variant, as defined by the merchant.

barcode.description: Unique product number of the variant. This might be a barcode, UPC, ISBN, etc.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the variant, such as `kg` or `meters`.

vatPercentage.description: VAT rate for the product variant if sales taxes are enabled.

prices.description: Prices for the product variants in different currencies.

inventory.description: Information about the total inventory as well as the locations inventory is in.

shippingRequired.description: Indicates whether or not the product requires physical delivery.

createdDate.description: The date the entity was created.
createdDate.title: Date Time

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of records to return in a page. [Read more](https://docs.codat.io/using-the-api/paging).

get.description: The Products data type provides the company's product inventory, and includes the price and quantity of all products, and product variants, available for sale.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

items.title: Transaction
items.description:
Details of all financial transactions recorded in the commerce or point of sale system are added to the Transactions data type. For example, payments, service charges, and fees.

You can use data from the Transactions endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as:  
- Transaction volumes  
- Average transaction volume  
- Average transaction value  
- Returns  
- Payouts

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-transactions) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

type.description:
The type of the platform transaction:  
- `Unknown`  
- `FailedPayout` â€” Failed transfer of funds from the seller's merchant account to their bank account.  
- `Payment` â€” Credit and debit card payments.  
- `PaymentFee` â€” Payment provider's fee on each card payment.  
- `PaymentFeeRefund` â€” Payment provider's fee that has been refunded to the seller.  
- `Payout` â€” Transfer of funds from the seller's merchant account to their bank account.  
- `Refund` â€” Refunds to a customer's credit or debit card.  
- `Transfer` â€” Secure transfer of funds to the seller's bank account.

subType.description: Non-standardised transaction type data from the commerce platform

transactionSourceRef.description: Link to the source event which triggered this transaction

type.description: The type of record being referenced.

createdDate.title: Date Time

sourceCreatedDate.title: Date Time

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

items.title: Product Category
items.description:
Product categories are used to classify a group of products together, either by type (e.g. "Furniture"), or sometimes by tax profile.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-productCategories) for this data type.

id.description: The unique identifier of the product category

name.description: The name of the product category

ancestorRefs.description: A collection of parent product categories implicitly ordered with the immediate parent last in the list.

id.description: The unique identitifer of the record being referenced

type.description: The type of record being referenced.

hasChildren.description: A boolean indicating whether there are other product categories beneath this one in the hierarchy.

modifiedDate.description: The date the record was last updated in Codat's cache.

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: Date the product was last changed in the commerce or point of sale platform.

sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

items.title: Tax Component

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the Tax Rate Component in the source commerce platform.

rate.description: Rate of taxation represented as a fraction of the net price (typically in the range 0.00 - 1.00).

isCompound.description: The Boolean flag to indicate when a Tax Rate Component compounds on a sale.

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

id.description: The unique identitifer of the record being referenced

name.description: Name of the record being referenced.

rate.description: Tax amount on order line sale as available from source commerce platform.

items.description:
The Tax Components endpoints return tax rates data from the commerce platform, including tax rate names and values. This is to support the mapping of tax rates from the commerce platform to those in the accounting platform.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-disputes) for this data type.

get.description: This endpoint returns a lits of tax rates from the commerce platform, including tax rate names and values. This supports the mapping of tax rates from the commerce platform to the accounting platform.

CompanyInfo.title: Company Info
CompanyInfo.description:
In the Codat system, company information includes standard commercial details about 
a linked company, such as their address, phone number, and company registration.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=companyInfo) for this data type.

phoneNumbers.description: Phone numbers associated with the company

webLinks.description: Web links associated with the company

Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description:
When a customer places an order with the connected commerce store their details are added to the Customers dataset. You can use the data from the Customers endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as customer churn.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-customers) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

allOf.description:
Default currency of any transactional data for the customer, 
for example, orders or payments

allOf.title: Currency
allOf.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

line2.description: The second line of the address

city.description: The third line of the address, or city

region.description: The fourth line of the address, or region

postalCode.description: The postal (or zip) code for the address

note.description: Any additional information about the customer

Dispute.description:
A customer may file a payment dispute with their bank or other card issuer when they're unsatisfied with their purchase or believe they have been charged incorrectly. For example:  
- They didn't receive an order.  
- The product they received was different to the commerce store's description.  
- They've been the victim of online fraud.  

You can use data from the Disputes endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as the number of chargebacks.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-disputes) for this data type.

Locations.title: Locations
Locations.description:
The Locations datatype holds information on geographic locations at which stocks of products may be held, as referenced in the Products data type.

Locations also holds information on geographic locations where orders were placed, as referenced in the Orders data type.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-locations) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of this location

line1.description: The first line of the address

line2.description: The second line of the address

city.description: The third line of the address, or city

region.description: The fourth line of the address, or region

postalCode.description: The postal (or zip) code for the address

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

Order.title: Orders
Order.description:
Orders contain the transaction details for all products sold by the company, and include details of any payments, service charges, or refunds related to each order. You can use data from the Orders endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as gross sales values and monthly recurring revenue (MRR).

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-orders) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

orderNumber.description: Friendly reference for the order in the commerce or point of sale platform.

country.description: The Codat country property is returned as it was provided in the underlying platform by the company without any formatting on our part. Depending on the platform the value of this property will either be an ISO 3166 code (2-alpha or 3-alpha) or free-form text returned as a string name in our model. For POST operations against platforms that demand a specific format for the country code, we have documented accepted values in the [options](https://docs.codat.io/codat-api#/operations/get-companies-companyId-connections-connectionId-push) endpoint.

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.
Currency in which the order was placed.

totalAmount.description: Total amount of the order, including tax, net of any discounts and refunds.

totalDiscount.description: Total amount of discount applied to the order.

totalGratuity.description: Extra amount added to a bill.

unitPrice.description: Price per unit of goods or service.

taxes.description: Taxes breakdown as applied to order lines.

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description:
Payments contain details of all payments made by customers to a company, including: amounts, currency used, payment method, payment provider, and payment status.

Refunds are recorded as separate, negative payments. Note that a refund can only occur in relation to a payment that has been completed (i.e. has a status of `Paid`). When a customer cancels an order _before_ a payment has been completed, the payment shows as `Cancelled`.

You can use data from the Payments endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as gross sales and monthly recurring revenue (MRR).

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-payments) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

currency.description: Currency in which the payment was made
currency.title: Currency

paymentMethodRef.description: The payment method the payment is linked to in the commerce platform.

PaymentMethod.description:
A Payment Method represents the payment method(s) used to make payments.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-paymentMethods) for this data type.

Product.title: Product
Product.description:
A Product is an item in the company's inventory, and includes information about the price and quantity of all products, and variants thereof, available for sale.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-products) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the product in the commerce or POS system

description.description: Description of the product recorded in the commerce or point of sale platform.
examples: 1 hour of support from an agent (phone or remote)

categorization.description: Retail category that the product is assigned to

isGiftCard.description:
Whether the product represents a gift card or voucher that
can be redeemed in the commerce or POS platform

items.title: Product Variant
items.description: Represents a variation of a product available for sale, for example an item of clothing that may be available for sale in multiple sizes and colors.

allOf.description: Identifier of the product variant, unique to the company.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the product recorded in the commerce or point of sale platform.

isTaxEnabled.description: Whether sales taxes are enabled for this product variant.

sku.description: SKU (stock keeping unit) of the variant, as defined by the merchant.

barcode.description: Unique product number of the variant. This might be a barcode, UPC, ISBN, etc.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the variant, such as `kg` or `meters`.

vatPercentage.description: VAT rate for the product variant if sales taxes are enabled.

prices.description: Prices for the product variants in different currencies.

inventory.description: Information about the total inventory as well as the locations inventory is in.

shippingRequired.description: Indicates whether or not the product requires physical delivery.

createdDate.description: The date the entity was created.
createdDate.title: Date Time

modifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in Codat.
modifiedDate.title: Date Time

sourceModifiedDate.description: The date on which this record was last modified in the originating system
sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

ProductCategory.title: Product Category
ProductCategory.description:
Product categories are used to classify a group of products together, either by type (e.g. "Furniture"), or sometimes by tax profile.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-productCategories) for this data type.

id.description: The unique identifier of the product category

name.description: The name of the product category

ancestorRefs.description: A collection of parent product categories implicitly ordered with the immediate parent last in the list.

id.description: The unique identitifer of the record being referenced

type.description: The type of record being referenced.

hasChildren.description: A boolean indicating whether there are other product categories beneath this one in the hierarchy.

modifiedDate.description: The date the record was last updated in Codat's cache.

sourceModifiedDate.description: Date the product was last changed in the commerce or point of sale platform.

sourceModifiedDate.title: Date Time

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

name.description: Name of the Tax Rate Component in the source commerce platform.

rate.description: Rate of taxation represented as a fraction of the net price (typically in the range 0.00 - 1.00).

isCompound.description: The Boolean flag to indicate when a Tax Rate Component compounds on a sale.

id.description: The unique identitifer of the record being referenced

name.description: Name of the record being referenced.

rate.description: Tax amount on order line sale as available from source commerce platform.

TaxComponent.description:
The Tax Components endpoints return tax rates data from the commerce platform, including tax rate names and values. This is to support the mapping of tax rates from the commerce platform to those in the accounting platform.

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-disputes) for this data type.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description:
Details of all financial transactions recorded in the commerce or point of sale system are added to the Transactions data type. For example, payments, service charges, and fees.

You can use data from the Transactions endpoints to calculate key metrics, such as:  
- Transaction volumes  
- Average transaction volume  
- Average transaction value  
- Returns  
- Payouts

Explore our [data coverage](https://knowledge.codat.io/supported-features/commerce?view=tab-by-data-type&dataType=commerce-transactions) for this data type.

id.description: A unique, persistent identifier for this record

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code, e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

type.description:
The type of the platform transaction:  
- `Unknown`  
- `FailedPayout` â€” Failed transfer of funds from the seller's merchant account to their bank account.  
- `Payment` â€” Credit and debit card payments.  
- `PaymentFee` â€” Payment provider's fee on each card payment.  
- `PaymentFeeRefund` â€” Payment provider's fee that has been refunded to the seller.  
- `Payout` â€” Transfer of funds from the seller's merchant account to their bank account.  
- `Refund` â€” Refunds to a customer's credit or debit card.  
- `Transfer` â€” Secure transfer of funds to the seller's bank account.

subType.description: Non-standardised transaction type data from the commerce platform

transactionSourceRef.description: Link to the source event which triggered this transaction
